bug.short_desc: Please bundle the libzzip library included with MilkyTracker in order to fix broken zip support

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Now that the Fedora packaging policy has been changed in order to allow bundled libraries, it would be nice to have MilkyTracker updated to the latest version, with the bundled libzzip, in order to allow opening zip files (using the system libzzip results in broken zip support), instead of using the system libzzip, which results in broken zip file support.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 0.90.85, but version 0.90.86 is available since at least 2 years.
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open MilkyTracker 2. Try to open a zip file containing a module
Actual results: An error opening the zip file occurs
Expected results: The module inside the zip file is opened
Additional info:

I will attempt to address this issue in near future.
To test the zip file support, can I just make some module file and put it into a zip file root? Or does the zip file need some specific layout?

Putting the zip module file in the root is fine, just take a look at the songs that you find on
http://milkytracker.org/?download
For example the song
http://milkytracker.org/songs/Strobe-Delusional.zip
should work as it is, without needing to extract it from the zip file.
Milkytracker 0.90.86-1 was just built for rawhide. It could open zip files on my system.
milkytracker-0.90.86-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-dabc67c2c5
milkytracker-0.90.86-1.fc22 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 22. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-7bc52ce85c

milkytracker-0.90.86-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-dabc67c2c5

milkytracker-0.90.86-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-7bc52ce85c

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
milkytracker-0.90.86-1.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
